questions.question: What is the main purpose of regularization in machine learning?

options.B: To increase the complexity of the model

questions.question: Which of the following evaluation metrics is most suitable for imbalanced classification problems?
What is the primary objective of Principal Component Analysis (PCA) in machine learning?
Which algorithm is commonly used for reinforcement learning and has beaten human champions in various games?
Which type of learning is demonstrated by a child learning to differentiate between cats and dogs by being shown various examples of each?
What does the bias-variance trade-off refer to in machine learning?

options.A: Balancing training time and testing time
options.B: Balancing the model's complexity and its ability to generalize

questions.question: Which technique is used to convert categorical variables into a numerical format that machine learning algorithms can process?
Which ensemble method combines the predictions of multiple models using a weighted average approach?
What is the purpose of cross-validation in machine learning?

options.A: To train the model on all available data
options.B: To test the model on multiple datasets
options.C: To evaluate the model's performance on unseen data
options.D: To speed up the training process

questions.question: Which of the following algorithms is a decision tree-based ensemble technique?
What is the primary drawback of using the k-nearest neighbors (KNN) algorithm?

options.A: It requires a lot of memory
options.B: It is only suitable for binary classification
options.C: It is sensitive to outliers and noise

questions.question: In machine learning, what does the term 'bias' refer to?

options.A: The error introduced by the model's inability to capture underlying patterns
options.B: The difference between the predicted and actual values
options.C: The tendency of a model to perform well on the training data but poorly on new data
options.D: The variance in the data distribution

questions.question: Which algorithm is commonly used for natural language processing tasks such as text generation and language translation?
What is the primary purpose of the Adam optimization algorithm commonly used in training neural networks?

options.A: To minimize the number of iterations needed for convergence
options.D: To speed up the training process

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a dimensionality reduction technique?
Which type of machine learning algorithm aims to map inputs to outputs based on example input-output pairs?
In the context of neural networks, what does 'backpropagation' refer to?

options.A: The process of training a model using reinforcement learning
options.B: The process of propagating data backward through the network during inference
options.C: The process of updating weights and biases based on prediction errors
options.D: The process of selecting features for model training

questions.question: Which evaluation metric is appropriate for regression problems and measures the average squared difference between predicted and actual values?
What does the term 'overfitting' mean in the context of machine learning?

options.A: The model's inability to capture underlying patterns in the data
options.B: The model performing well on unseen data
options.C: The model being too simple to capture the data's complexity
options.D: The model performing well on the training data but poorly on new data
